results.title: Hidden costs
results.creator_credit: James Mann, Tony Paice and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Looks at the hidden cost of shoplifting not only to the consumer and shopkeepers, but the cost to the legal system and the consequences for the offender.Aimed at a teenage audience.

results.title: Go Between. My Name Is Asher Lev
results.brief_description: Designed for senior students of English, this programme features a lecture on the “The Go-between”, by L.P. Hartley, and “My name is Asher Lev” by Chaim Potok. Critical issues and significant passages are discussed.

results.title: The Orchard, timber yard, Oakbank farm
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke, James Mann and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
This program looks at three different work environments, an apple orchard a timber yard and a children’s animal farm. We see the people who work there, find out what each job entails and the process used to accomplish the various tasks involved.

results.title: The Firefighter, Police helicopter, Police officer
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke, James Mann and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
Shows the work done by a firefighter, by policemen who man the police helicopter and the work of a various police officers from senior sargents to motor cycle police. The duties and responsibilities of each profession and the necessary equipment and supplies required by each person in order to get the job done.

results.title: Occupational health & safety act of Victoria
results.brief_description: A program to explain how the Safety Act relates to the workplace of Victoria. Part 1. Introduction and outline of respective duties of employers manufactures and employees and roles of the Department of Labour. Victorian Occupational Health and Safety Commission and occupational health and safety representatives. Part 2. Looks at keys to success with consultative arrangements for resolving workplace issues. Part 3. Outlines ways problems can be resolved.

results.title: Kids making decisions
results.creator_credit: Tony Paice, Corporate Relations Unit and Victoria. Inner City School Support Centre
results.brief_description: A program for primary teachers highlighting key features in developing integrated curriculum. An integrated curriculum goes beyond a thematic approach and involves coordinating all curriculum areas around one chosen topic to promote the development of learning. Shows teachers and their classes in three Western Metropolitan schools involved in choosing a topic, ordering concept areas and contributing questions. The pupils are involved by taking responsibility for their own learning in making key decisions.

results.title: Sunrise profession: land degradation hypothetical
results.creator_credit: John Nairn, John Nicholson and La Trobe University
results.brief_description: Part 1. An introduction to the School of Agriculture courses at La Trobe University, highlighting hi-tech science, state of the art facilities, applied problem solving, global issues, real world economics, innovative teaching and breakthough research. Part 2. An agricultural hypothetical teaching exercise on land degradation dealing with the salinity problems in northern Victoria.

results.title: The Dream. The Maskmaker. Youth, maturity, old age, death. The Sideshow.
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
Features Marcel Marceau. “The Dream” presents the idea of dreaming. The Maskmaker” shows the many faces of man. “Youth, Maturity, Old Age, Death symbolically presents the cycle of life beginning with life emerging from the womb through to the grave. “The Sideshow” is a pantomime of circus performers demonstrating their skills.
results.title_for_label: The Dream. The Maskmaker. Youth, maturity, old age, death. The Sideshow.

results.title: Bip as a soldier; The Hands; The Painter.
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
A compilation tape featuring Marcel Marceau, introducing the art of mime through the characater of Bip. “Bip as a soldier” shows the soldier as a tragic and heroic figure. “The Hands” is an allegory of the struggle between good and evil. The serious tone is lightened by the interpretation of “The Painter”.
results.title_for_label: Bip as a soldier; The Hands; The Painter.
